question: Question_08_(b)
statement:
Consider the matrix

\[A = \left(\begin{array}{ccccc}
1 & 0 & -1 & 2 & 4 \\
0 & 1 & -2 & 0 & -1 \\
-1 & -2 & 5 & 1 & 4 \\
1 & 0 & -1 & 1 & 2
\end{array}\right)\]

\textbf{b)} Find the dimension of the nullspace of \emph{A}.
sols:
By the rank-nullity theorem, we know that dim($\mathbb{R}^5$) =
dim(column space) + dim(kernel). Because \emph{A} is a linear
transformation from $\mathbb{R}^5$, and the dimension of the column
space of \emph{A} is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is
2.
hints:
Think of the matrix \emph{A} as a linear transformation from
$\mathbb{R}^5 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$.
